description: Modify the contact-resolution strategy for faceted walls. By default, the resolution strategy is set to the 'reduced' state. In all cases, contact activity based on contact with active/inactive facet sides (see wall active-sides) is determined. Note: Eliciting this command does not result in an automatic 'cleaning' of the model state. See 'Faceted Walls in PFC' section for detailed explanation of resolution strategies.

keywords.name: full
keywords.description: Full contact resolution. Checks sliver penetration conditions, cutoff angle active for contact-state propagation for convex/concave facet intersections. Proximity contacts created by default unless 'proximity false' specified. Most accurate but computationally expensive

keywords.name: reduced
keywords.description: Reduced contact resolution (default). Does NOT check sliver penetration or propagate contact-state information. Applies associative logic for contact activity state. More computationally efficient than full. No proximity contacts created

keywords.name: none
keywords.description: No contact resolution. Most computationally efficient but may result in many more active contacts (reducing overall performance). May cause unexpected responses for walls intended to be smooth

examples.description: Set full resolution mode - proximity contacts created, contact-state propagation for planar/convex wall sides
Set full resolution mode but disable proximity contact creation
Set reduced resolution mode (default) - intermediate state, no proximity contacts
Turn off all contact resolution - all contacts with wall facets are active

python_sdk_alternative.workaround: itasca.command('wall resolution ...') - Python SDK does not provide wall resolution settings. This is a global contact resolution strategy
